title: How to Make Leftover Halloween Candy Brownies

steps.headline: Remove leftover chocolate candy from wrapper and chop into very small pieces.
Grease baking tray with cooking spray.
Pour brownie mix into a medium mixing bowl.
Add 1/4 cup water, 2/3 cup vegetable oil and 2 eggs to mixing bowl.
Spread half of brownie mixture into pan.
Sprinkle layer of chopped leftover chocolate candy on top of brownie mix.
Pour remaining brownie mix on top of sprinkled candy.
Remove brownies and sprinkle remaining leftover chocolate candy on top of brownies.
Place brownies back into the oven and bake for 5 more minutes.
Remove brownies and allow them to cool for at least one hour.

text: Preheat oven to 350 °F (177 °C).  Remove leftover chocolate candy from wrapper and chop into very small pieces.  Grease baking tray with cooking spray.  Pour brownie mix into a medium mixing bowl.  Add 1/4 cup water, 2/3 cup vegetable oil and 2 eggs to mixing bowl.  Stir mixture manually until smooth.  Spread half of brownie mixture into pan.  Sprinkle layer of chopped leftover chocolate candy on top of brownie mix.  Pour remaining brownie mix on top of sprinkled candy.  Bake in oven for 20 minutes.  Remove brownies and sprinkle remaining leftover chocolate candy on top of brownies.  Place brownies back into the oven and bake for 5 more minutes.  Remove brownies and allow them to cool for at least one hour. Enjoy!
